docs.lead_paragraph: Pat Toomey, who looks to be well on his way to capturing the Republican nomination for the Senate in Pennsylvania, is plugging himself as a job creator in his first television advertisement of the campaign.

headline.main: Toomey Hits the Airwaves in Pennsylvania

docs.abstract: Pat Toomey, the likely Republican nominee for Senate in Pennsylvania, has released his first television advertisement of the campaign.
docs.snippet: Pat Toomey, the likely Republican nominee for Senate in Pennsylvania, has released his first television advertisement of the campaign.

docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appear daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.

headline.main: Monday Reading: Fight Over Mental Health Insurance Rules

docs.abstract: A fight erupts over mental health insurance rules, how to get your money's worth when taking golf lessons and other consumer-focused items from The Times.
docs.snippet: A fight erupts over mental health insurance rules, how to get your money's worth when taking golf lessons and other consumer-focused items from The Times.

headline.main: Will Insurers Be Required to Cover My Family's Costs?

docs.abstract: New state and regional health insurance exchanges will provide coverage more comprehensive than is often available today in the individual market.
docs.snippet: New state and regional health insurance exchanges will provide coverage more comprehensive than is often available today in the individual market.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama will nominate Solicitor General Elena Kagan to be the nation's 112th Supreme Court justice, choosing his own chief advocate as the successor to Justice John Paul Stevens.

headline.main: The Early Word: Supreme Court Pick

docs.abstract: President Obama is expected to announce that he's chosen Elena Kagan, the solicitor general, as his next nominee for the Supreme Court.
docs.snippet: President Obama is expected to announce that he's chosen Elena Kagan, the solicitor general, as his next nominee for the Supreme Court.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate readies for a Supreme Court pick by President Obama as Democrats try to bring the floor debate over Wall Street rules to a conclusion by the end of the week.

headline.main: Senate Resumes Debate on Financial Bill

docs.abstract: Also on the agenda are hearings on the Gulf oil spill, as senators also begin scrutinizing President Obama's expected pick for the Supreme Court.
docs.snippet: Also on the agenda are hearings on the Gulf oil spill, as senators also begin scrutinizing President Obama's expected pick for the Supreme Court.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nancy Folbre is an economics professor at the University of Massachusetts Amherst.
docs.abstract: The Census Bureau is working on a new way to measure poverty, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Virgin Green Fund, an investment firm backed by Richard Branson, is not, in fact, going after the hottest new clean energy start-ups. It wants the ones facing a midlife crisis.
